roleset.name: disappoint, let down

example.name: verbal, active
example.text: Known as Easy Eggs , the product has disappointed investors .

example.name: verbal, passive
example.text: First Union , with assets of about $ 32 billion , said it was disappointed by the delay but said it would cooperate with regulatory authorities .

example.name: adjectival, NP arg0
example.text: Mr. Nichol said he was `` extremely disappointed in the continuing deterioration of the company 's operations while it attempted to conclude the reorganization during the past four months . ''

propbank.arg: in the continuing deterioration of the company 's operations while it attempted to conclude the reorganization during the past four months

example.name: adjectival, SBAR arg0
example.text: It shed about 7 pence , however , after dealers said the market was disappointed that Ford did n't move to tender a bid for control of the company .

propbank.arg: that Ford did n't move to tender a bid for control of the company

example.name: ARG1 and ARG0
example.text: They were extremely disappointed with the sound on Autumn Moon , so they decided to go to Australia to redo it .

propbank.arg: with the sound on Autumn Moon
so they decided to go to Australia to redo it

example.name: unk
example.text: To be sure , ignorance of new trends is not recommended , but looking too far into the future can also lead to disappointment .

example.name: args 0 and 1 again
example.text: The disappointment of neighboring countries in him

example.name: arg 0 and 1
example.text: its disappointment at the effect of the resolutions

propbank.arg: at the effect of the resolutions

example.name: args 0, 2
example.text: He was disappointing with his finishing and even failed to link up play with his teammates .

example.name: with arg0
example.text: I 'm sorry that the pool being outdoors was disappointing to you , it 's normally a big hit in the summer .

roleset.note: DISAPPOINT-V NOTES: As with 'surprise', the line between verbal passives and adjectivalsis almost nonexistent. Note, for example, that the Ford example abovecan be easily paraphrased as "That Ford didn't move to tender a bidfor control of the company disappointed the market." (For thisreason, the complementizer MUST be included in the arg.) (from disappoint.01-v)
DISAPPOINTMENT-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Comparison to 'disapoint'. Vn class amuse-31.1. Framed by Katie. (from disappointment.01-n)
DISAPPOINTING-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WSJ data, disappoint-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls amuse-31.1. (from disappointing.01-j)
DISAPPOINTED-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from disappointed.01-j)
